title: Exhibit: The Perfect Sea Mural
description:
Date: October 5, 2021

Members of the South Shore Artists Group created an engaging and interactive mural entitled "The Perfect Sea" to educate children and adults about the sea and its ecology; in particular, how pollution affects sea life in our local waters.

The exhibition will be on display at the Lenape Gallery at the Conference House Park Visitors Center through the end of the year.

Free admission.

All current COVID-19 protocols to be followed

Start time: 10:00 am

End time: 4:00 pm

Contact phone: (917) 417-6917

Location: Conference House Park Visitor Center (in Conference House Park)
location: Conference House Park Visitor Center (in Conference House Park)
categories: Education | Art | Best for Kids | Seniors

title: Exhibit: Fire and Tide - Terra Marine Inn: A Brief History of Huguenot Park, Staten Island
description:
Date: October 5, 2021

Explore a bit of Staten Island's past and history.

The Fire and Tide exhibition explores the history of the former turn of the century Terra Marine Inn. This hotel was a wonderful piece of Staten Island gilded past. The exhibit combines history and original artwork focusing on the bygone location.

Free admission. Exhibit on display through December.

All COVID-19 protocols to be followed.

Start time: 10:00 am

End time: 4:00 pm

Contact phone: (917) 417-6817

Location: Conference House Park Visitor Center (in Conference House Park)
location: Conference House Park Visitor Center (in Conference House Park)
categories: Art | History

title: Fall Volunteer Days at the Bronx River Foodway
description:
Date: October 5, 2021

Lend a hand and connect with community and friends during our upcoming First Saturdays at the Foodway programming! Support morning stewardship, which includes gardening and beautifying of New York City's only edible food forest. Join us as well for some tours around our food forest, where we discuss the value of these herbs and veggies for both our health and the environment.

Hand sanitizer, masks, gloves, social distancing guidelines, and temperature checks provided to prevent the spread of Covid-19.

Thank you for being interested in volunteering with the Bronx River Alliance. You are committing to a special effort during a special time.

Please review the NYC Guidelines for Volunteering in Parks during COVID:

  • Stay home if sick (e.g., running a fever, coughing, experiencing loss of taste or smell, or other Covid-19 symptoms)
  • Maintain 6 feet of distance
  • Wash hands and clean surfaces frequently
  • Wear face coverings

Start time: 10:00 am

End time: 12:00 pm

Contact phone: (718) 542-4284

Location: Concrete Plant Park
categories: Nature | Best for Kids | Tours | Volunteer | Waterfront

title: Summer on the Hudson: Moving For Life
description:
Date: October 5, 2021

Moving for Life is a gentle workout that begins with breathing exercises, then moves into active aerobic dancing that strengthens body awareness.

Pre-registration for the event is required. Management reserves the right to cap participation in accordance with current COVID-19 outdoor safety guidelines.

Please register online.

Please note: We are offering outdoor programs with limited attendance so that you can have a safe and enjoyable time in parks. Based on New York State guidance for outdoor events during COVID-19, we’ve put protocols into place to keep our participants and staff safe and healthy. We're asking everyone to help us stay safe.

Know Before You Go:

For everyone's safety, we are asking all participants to observe the following guidelines:

  • Please wear a mask if you are unvaccinated, or if it makes you feel more comfortable
  • All individuals should maintain social distancing of six feet during programming, regardless of vaccination status
  • Please wear a mask if social distancing cannot be maintained
  • Wash your hands before attending a program
  • Stay home if you are sick

Additionally, we encourage participants to bring their own hand sanitizer to our programs.

Start time: 5:30 pm

End time: 6:30 pm

Contact phone: (212) 870-3070

title: River Project: Diversity Digest
description:
Date: October 6, 2021

During Diversity Digest, you'll learn what it means to be a naturalist, cataloging local wildlife with the free iNaturalist app throughout the week and then sharing your observations with the HRPK community. Together, we'll congratulate those who made the most observations and highlight some of our favorite images. You’ll also get a chance to ask Park staff questions!

HRPK's River Project conducts research and offers hands-on environmental education and scientific programming with the purpose of communicating the ecological importance of the Park’s 400-acre Estuarine Sanctuary. Dedicated to community engagement, stewardship and learning, the River Project offers at-home STEM activities, tours of marine-biology stations and other educational resources to support scientific understanding of the Lower Hudson Estuary.

Join us on Facebook live @HudsonRiverPark. If you are a teacher or educator and would like to have your class join via Zoom, please contact education@hrpt.ny.gov.

Start time: 12:00 pm

End time: 12:30 pm

Contact phone: (212) 627-2020

title: Greenbelt Story Time: Skeletons and Skulls
description:
Date: October 7, 2021

Join us outside at the Greenbelt Nature Center for skeleton stories. We will have our animal collection of skulls and skeletons for all to see. The program will take place outdoors, weather permitting. Social distancing and masks are a must.

Registration: By registering for this event, you confirm that you have read our Covid-19 precautions and media consent. The event is free but registration is required.

Location: Meet at the Greenbelt Nature Center.

Public Transportation to Greenbelt Nature Center: By bus from the Staten Island Ferry Terminal: Take the S62 bus to Bradley Avenue. Transfer to the S57 bus, which will take you to the Brielle and Rockland Ave. stop. Cross the street at the light.

By Train from the Staten Island Ferry Terminal: Take the SIRR toward Tottenville, and get off at the New Dorp stop (9 stops). Walk about 1 minute down New Dorp Lane to Rose Avenue and New Dorp Plaza to get on the S57 bus toward Port Richmond. Go about 10 minutes (10 stops) and get off the bus at Rockland Av/Brielle Av. Walk 1 minute to Greenbelt Nature Center.

Gear: Wear weather-appropriate clothes. Closed-toed shoes (sneakers or boots) are required.

Cancellation: This program may be canceled if registration is too low, or if there is inclement weather predicted on the day of the event. Please ensure that we have your correct information so that we can contact you in the event of a cancellation. As we receive cancellations, names will be added from the waitlist. If you know you will be unable to attend, please cancel your registration by email at sigreenbelteducation@gmail.com or by phone at (718) 351-3450 ext. 0, so we can fill the reservation.

Media Consent: By registering for this program, you are agreeing to have your image used in promotional materials by the Greenbelt Conservancy, including but not limited to, photographs and video. If you choose not to give consent, please let us know by emailing us at sigreenbelteducation@gmail.com before the event.

Covid-19 Precautions:
-All Visitors and Staff must wear a mask during the entire event.
-Masks and Hand sanitizer will be available.
-All equipment/supplies will be sanitized before and after the event.
-By participating in this event you are acknowledging that you and your guests have not experienced a fever, not tested positive for COVID-19, have not been exposed to anyone with COVID-19 or traveled to a restricted location within 14 days of the event. Should you develop symptoms after registration, please cancel your registration by email.ing sigreenbelteducation@gmail.com.

Start time: 10:00 am

End time: 11:00 am

Contact phone:

Location: Greenbelt Nature Center (in Blood Root Valley)
location: Greenbelt Nature Center (in Blood Root Valley)
categories: Nature | Best for Kids

title: River Project: Live From the Field
description:
Date: October 7, 2021

Wildlife thrives all over NYC, especially in HRPK's waters! Tune into @HudsonRiverPark's Instagram Live for an insider’s look into the Park's Estuarine Sanctuary as we study environmental DNA, analyze microplastics, sample fish populations and so much more!

HRPK's River Project conducts research and offers hands-on environmental education and scientific programming with the purpose of communicating the ecological importance of the Park’s 400-acre Estuarine Sanctuary. Dedicated to community engagement, stewardship and learning, the River Project offers at-home STEM activities, tours of marine-biology stations and other educational resources to support scientific understanding of the Lower Hudson Estuary.

Start time: 2:00 pm

title: River Project: Wetlab Look-Ins
description:
Date: October 7, 2021

Our flow-through aquarium houses dozens of species of fish and invertebrates all caught within the Park as part of an ongoing ecological survey. Park staff will be available for tours and questions during the duration of open hours. If you can't make it to Pier 40, we will also be live streaming feeding and/or species spotlights each day on Facebook live @hudsonriverpark.

Animals are released each season to ensure that their behaviors and life cycles are minimally impacted.

Please make sure to bring a mask if you are attending in person.

title: Re-Imagine Lefferts Historic House: A Community Conversation with Meredith Sorin-Horsford, Director of the Dyckman Farmhouse Museum
description:
Date: October 7, 2021

Prospect Park Alliance presents a Community Conversation with Meredith Sorin-Horsford, Director of the Dyckman Farmhouse Museum, as part of its “Re-Imagine Lefferts Historic House” initiative to re-envision the mission and programming of this historic house museum while it undergoes restoration to recognize the role the house played as a site of slavery, and tell the stories of enslaved Africans and Native Americans who lived and worked the land.

In this Community Conversation, Sorin-Horsford and Maria Carrasco, the Vice President of Public Programs at Prospect Park Alliance, will focus on ways of elevating enslaved African narratives. Sorin-Horsford will discuss the DyckmanDISCOVERED initiative developed by her team, which investigates the stories of enslaved people who lived and worked on Dutch farms in what is now called Inwood. This initiative brings an inclusive history to the community, fosters a sense of transparency, and hopes to engage visitors who have not seen themselves represented in the current narrative.

The restoration of Lefferts Historic House is made possible through $2.5 million in funding from the Brooklyn Delegation of the New York City Council, and includes replacing the roof, restoring the exterior of the building, and repairing paths and drainage surrounding the house. The restoration is currently underway, and slated to be completed in 2022.

This event is free and open to the public. It will take place outside on the Carousel lawn, across from Lefferts Historic House. RSVPs are suggested, but not required, for admittance.

Prospect Park Alliance takes the safety of their patrons and staff very seriously. Please wear a mask and follow social distancing guidelines.

This event is presented in partnership with Lefferts Historic House.

Start time: 5:30 pm

End time: 6:30 pm

Contact phone: (212) 304-9422

Location: The Carousel (in Prospect Park)
categories: History | Talks

title: Movies Under the Stars: The Wedding Date
description:
Date: October 7, 2021

Join NYC Parks and the New York City Mayor's Office of Media and Entertainment for a free film!

Grab a blanket and come enjoy a movie in a neighborhood park or playground! Movies begin at dusk. You should arrive before 6:00 p.m. to get your spot. This event is FREE and open to the public, but seating is limited. Reservations are not taken.

The Wedding Date

Single-girl anxiety causes Kat Ellis to hire a male escort to pose as her boyfriend at her sister's wedding. Her plan, an attempt to dupe her ex-fiancé, who dumped her a couple years prior, proves to be her undoing. Rated PG-13

Fans everywhere can now experience Pikachu on the big screen as never before, as Detective Pikachu, a Pokémon like no other. description:

The exhibition will be on display at the Lenape Gallery at the Conference House Park Visitors Center through the end of the year.

Free admission.

All current COVID-19 protocols to be followed

title: Exhibit: Fire and Tide - Terra Marine Inn: A Brief History of Huguenot Park, Staten Island
description:
Date: October 8, 2021

Explore a bit of Staten Island's past and history.

The Fire and Tide exhibition explores the history of the former turn of the century Terra Marine Inn. This hotel was a wonderful piece of Staten Island gilded past. The exhibit combines history and original artwork focusing on the bygone location.

Free admission. Exhibit on display through December.

All COVID-19 protocols to be followed.

Start time: 10:00 am

title: Highbridge Film Festival: Coco
description:
Date: October 8, 2021

Join NYC Parks and the New York City Mayor's Office of Media and Entertainment for a free film!

Coco

Aspiring musician Miguel, confronted with his family's ancestral ban on music, enters the Land of the Dead to find his great-great-grandfather, a legendary singer. PG

Grab a blanket and snuggle up for this year’s Fall Film Festival at Highbridge Pool Deck. NYC Parks will host a series of movie screenings accompanied by fun and exciting activities fit for the whole family.

Check what will happen on Fridays

September 24, 2021

5:30 p.m. // Scavenger Hunt

7:00 p.m. // Dora and the Last City of Gold

October 1, 2021

6:00 p.m. // Dance Cardio Class

7:00 p.m. // Selena

October 8, 2021

6:00 p.m. // Arts & Crafts

7:00 p.m. // Coco

October 15, 2021

4:00 p.m. // Block Party

7:00 p.m. // In the Heights

Know Before You Go:

For everyone's safety, we are asking all participants to observe the following guidelines:

  • Please wear a mask if you are unvaccinated, or if it makes you feel more comfortable
  • All individuals should maintain social distancing of six feet during programming, regardless of vaccination status
  • Please wear a mask if social distancing cannot be maintained
  • Wash your hands before attending a program
  • Stay home if you are sick

Glass bottles and alcoholic beverages are strictly prohibited.

Contact (212) 360-1430 or accessibility@parks.nyc.gov for more information regarding accessibility.

title: Movies Under the Stars: SHOCKTOBERFEST - Love and Monsters
description:
Date: October 8, 2021

Join NYC Parks and New York City Mayor's Office of Media and Entertainment at SHOCKTOBERFEST with these spooky films!

Love and Monsters

In a monster-infested world, Joel learns his girlfriend is just 80 miles away. To make the dangerous journey, Joel discovers his inner hero to be with the girl of his dreams. Rated PG-13.

Know Before You Go
You should arrive by 6:30 p.m. to get your spot for the movie. Please bring your own picnic blanket or chair. Food is OK, but no alcohol or smoking is permitted. All are welcome!

For everyone's safety, we are asking all participants to observe the following guidelines:

  • Please wear a mask if you are unvaccinated, or if it makes you feel more comfortable
  • All individuals should maintain social distancing of six feet during programming, regardless of vaccination status
  • Please wear a mask if social distancing cannot be maintained
  • Wash your hands before attending a program
  • Stay home if you are sick

Contact (212) 360-1430 or accessibility@parks.nyc.gov for more information regarding accessibility.

Start time: 6:30 pm

End time: 8:20 pm

Contact phone: (718) 965-8942

Location: Carroll Park
categories: Film | Halloween | Free Summer Movies

title: Movies Under the Stars: The Little Mermaid
description:
Date: October 8, 2021

Join NYC Parks and the New York City Mayor's Office of Media and Entertainment for a free film!

A young mermaid strikes a deal with a sea witch to become human in order to land the man of her dreams, even though her father has forbidden her to swim to the surface. Rated G.

Grab a blanket and come enjoy a movie in a neighborhood park or playground! This summer, NYC Parks will host family-friendly movie showings across the five boroughs. Movies begin at dusk. You should arrive before 6:30 p.m. to get your spot. This event is FREE and open to the public, but seating is limited. Reservations are not taken.

Know Before You Go:

For everyone's safety, we are asking all participants to observe the following guidelines:

  • Please wear a mask if you are unvaccinated, or if it makes you feel more comfortable
  • All individuals should maintain social distancing of six feet during programming, regardless of vaccination status
  • Please wear a mask if social distancing cannot be maintained
  • Wash your hands before attending a program
  • Stay home if you are sick

Glass bottles and alcoholic beverages are strictly prohibited.

This movie is sponsored by Speaker Corey Johnson

Contact (212) 360-1430 or accessibility@parks.nyc.gov for more information regarding accessibility.

Start time: 6:30 pm

End time: 9:00 pm

Contact phone: (212) 408-0243

description:

Join NYC Parks and the New York City Mayor's Office of Media and Entertainment for a free film.

The Boss Baby

A 7-year-old boy has his life turned upside down by his new brother, an infant known as the Boss Baby who wears a suit and has the brusque manner of a businessman. However, the two are soon forced to work together on a mission of espionage involving the rivalry between babies and puppies. Rated PG.

Know Before You Go
You should arrive before 7:00 p.m. to get your spot. Feel free to bring a blanket to sit on; there will be a limited supply of chairs available. Bottled water is permitted, but not glass. Reservations are not taken; space is available on a first-come, first-served basis. All are welcome!

title: Kayak Tour
description:
Date: October 9, 2021

Kayak along Freshkills Park's waterways! This two-mile round-trip paddle is a chance to explore the creeks and shorelines of Freshkills Park and experience the wildlife while the site is closed to the public. We know this program fills quickly and wish we could offer it more frequently. But we have a small staff and are generally limited to trips on the weekend during high tide.

There is a $20 suggested donation per participant. Your donation supports education, programming, and research at the Freshkills Park Alliance and makes programs like this possible.

Registration: By registering for this event, you confirm you will provide your own transportation. Each ticket holder may bring up to 3 additional guests in their car. Due to limited reservations, carpooling with friends and family is encouraged.

Transportation: Because the site is under construction, all participants must provide their own car that will stay on-site the whole time. Participants may not use a bicycle, taxi or ride-share service.

Gear: Wear sturdy shoes that you don’t mind getting wet or muddy. Wear clothes that can get wet, and avoid heavy fabric like cotton and jeans. Please also bring water and sunblock. Life jackets will be provided and are required during the tour.

Technology: Feel free to take photos, but consider carefully before bringing any electronic devices with you as they may possibly get wet, damaged, or dropped during the program.

Restrictions: All visitors must be at least 16 years of age and able to kayak to attend this tour. You will be asked to sign an activity waiver before participating in the program.

Cancellation: This tour will be canceled if registration is too low, or if there is a 60% or greater chance of rain on the day of the event. You will be asked to confirm your registration by email before the tour. As we receive cancellations, names will be added from the waitlist. If you know you will be unable to attend, please cancel your registration by emailing info@freshkillspark.org so we can fill the reservation.

Covid-19 Precautions:

This event will follow the current NYC Parks safety guidelines.

Masks, gloves, and hand sanitizer will be available.

By participating in this event you are acknowledging that you and your guests have not experienced a fever, not tested positive for COVID-19, and have not been exposed to anyone with COVID-19 within 14 days of the event. Should you develop symptoms after registration, please cancel your registration by emailing info@freshkillspark.org.

Start time: 9:30 am

End time: 12:00 pm

Contact phone: (929) 481-2795

Location: Freshkills Park Event Entrance
categories: Nature | Fall Foliage | Kayaking and Canoeing | Waterfront | Wildlife

title: Second Saturdays Trailwork Party + Bike Share at Highbridge Bike Park
description:
Date: October 9, 2021

Dig, then ride with us on NYCMTB's monthly welcome days at Highbridge Park in Manhattan!

Bring your friends and family for a day of fun in the woods and learn what it takes to build, maintain, and ride the most progressive urban bike park in America! There will be light trail maintenance tasks for all ages from 10:00 a.m. to noon. All participants, NYCMTB members, or anyone with logged volunteer hours, receive a free 20-minute clinic and a guided ride throughout the trails from 12:30 p.m to 3:00 p.m. Bikes and helmets provided!

Highbridge Park is the home of NYC's first Mountain Biking Course. The 3-mile course offers trails of varying difficulty from intermediate to expert and a free-ride trail that includes drops, steeps, and berms. The park also features a dirt jump park and pump track, making it a good place to develop different skills at all levels. The course has been featured in national media and is stewarded by volunteers just like you!

Make this day your introduction to the park, or to the sport of off-road cycling. Interested volunteers are encouraged to participate regardless of age, ability or gender. There is something for everyone at Highbridge - It's NYC's bike park!

Please bring water, sunscreen, bug repellant, and sturdy shoes or boots.

Register on Eventbrite at nycmtb.eventbrite.com.

Start time: 10:00 am

End time: 3:00 pm

Contact phone: (734) 358-2826

Location: BMX Jump Park (in Highbridge Park)
categories: Fitness | Best for Kids | Sports | Volunteer | Outdoor Fitness | Workshops

title: Hellgate Farm Stand
description:
Date: October 9, 2021

Every Saturday at Socrates in the spring, summer, fall, Hellgate Farm offers fresh seasonal local produce and small batch goods, like their signature hot sauce. Cash, credit card and Venmo are accepted, plus Supplemental Nutrition Assistance Program (SNAP), Farmers’ Market Nutrition Program (FMNP), and Health Bucks. Wilk Apiaries also pops up on select Saturdays to vend their variety of local and raw honeys.

About Hellgate Farm

Hellgate Farm is a network of residential and rooftop gardens in Queens, NYC. The farm aims to promote urban gardening and a permaculture lifestyle within their local community, providing opportunities for people interested in these practices to connect and learn, as well as share in the abundance of the harvest.

title: Ocean Breeze Green Team Volunteer Event
description:
Date: October 9, 2021

Ocean Breeze Park is a beautiful 140-acre park consisting of wetlands, grasslands, and shrub forests. This area is home to innumerable species of wildlife needing your caring hands as we work together in stewardship and restoration of our beloved park. Volunteers will be participating in hands-on projects in our park and green spaces. This may include trail maintenance, clean-up projects, invasive weed removal, planting, and other environmental projects. Further information will be provided upon registration.

Fall 2021 Green Team Dates:

  • Saturday, October 2: 10am – noon
  • Saturday, October 9: 10am – noon
  • Saturday, October 16: 10am – noon
  • Saturday, October 23: 10am – noon
  • Sunday, October 24: 10am – noon
  • Saturday, November 13: 10am – noon

The Ocean Breeze Green Team includes environmental and stewardship projects for volunteers in the trails and at the facility. Tasks will include hands-on work like planting, mulching, debris removal, shoveling, crafting, and more. Equipment for the volunteer project will be provided, but we ask if you have lawn and garden gloves to please bring them with you.

Register at oceanbreezenyc.org/greenteam

Start time: 10:00 am

End time: 12:00 pm

Contact phone: (718) 351-7923

title: Central Park Youth Basketball Clinics
description:
Date: October 9, 2021

Enhance your basketball skills through small group instruction and competitive games.

It's not just shooting hoops! Our high-energy, interactive youth basketball clinics cultivate skill development, team play, and sportsmanship both on and off the court. Players aged 6–14 are encouraged to join us on Saturdays and Sundays from July 10 to August 28, 2021. From September 11 to October 30, 2021, clinics will be held on Saturdays only. FREE and open to players of all levels. On-site registration each day on a first-come, first-served basis.

Ages 6–10
11:00 a.m. – 11:30 a.m.: Check In
11:30 a.m. – 12:30 p.m.: Basketball Clinic

Ages 11–14
12:30 p.m. – 1:00 p.m.: Check In
1:00 p.m. – 2:30 p.m.: Basketball Clinic

In case of inclement weather, call (347) 443-0656 to confirm cancellation on the day.

COVID-19 HEALTH AND SAFETY POLICIES

Ensuring the health and safety of our guests, staff, and the public is our top priority. Central Park Conservancy programs follow recommended guidelines from the Centers for Disease Control and Prevention, New York State, and New York City and have adopted enhanced cleaning procedures to ensure a safe playing environment.

This year’s Youth Basketball Clinics ask unvaccinated players to:

  • wear face masks that completely cover their nose and mouth for the duration of the program.
  • complete an on-site health assessment and temperature check prior to playing.

Regardless of vaccination status, all players should continue to monitor themselves for COVID-19 symptoms and stay home if they feel unwell.

Read about policies related to COVID-19, inclement weather, and more on our Frequently Asked Questions page.

Please fill out the Health Assessment form prior to attending the program.

Start time: 11:00 am

title: Heritage Rose Volunteer Gardening Day
description:
Date: October 9, 2021

Gardeners of all ages are invited to join us on the grounds surrounding the Morris-Jumel Mansion for a day of community gardening!

Located in the center of Roger Morris Park, Morris-Jumel Mansion is part of the Heritage Rose District of NYC and is surrounded by local community gardens. Heritage, or old and unique varieties of roses, were beloved by the Mansion's longest resident, Eliza Jumel, and her second husband, Aaron Burr. Join master gardener Stephen Scanniello, President of the Heritage Rose Foundation and curator of the New York Botanical Garden's rose garden, and Morris-Jumel staff as we explore the history of the house and grounds through gardening.

Event presented in partnership with the Heritage Rose Foundation.

Free; masks required. Art activities will be limited to 30 people on a first-come, first-served basis.

Program:

  • 11:00 a.m.: Event begins. Cleaning up the flower beds and planting
  • Noon: Tour - Heritage Roses and Herbal Medicines tour of Sunken Garden
  • 12:30 p.m.: Sampling rose hip tea and jam
  • 1:00 p.m.: Family Day workshop begins: Make a self-watering seed pot! (Limited to first 30 participants)
  • 2:00 p.m.: Family Day workshop continues: Sketching in the gardens (Limited to first 30 participants)
  • 3:00 p.m.: Event concludes. Plant and bulb giveaway.

Start time: 11:00 am

End time: 3:00 pm

Contact phone: (212) 923-8008

Location: Morris-Jumel Mansion (in Roger Morris Park)

title: STREET/ART Brooklyn Gowanus Art Walk
description:
Date: October 9, 2021

Local artist Rich Garr leads this safe [masked, socially distant] open-air exploration through the Gowanus waterfront. He is a longtime area interdisciplinary artist focusing on public art and community. Every month he collages together this art-centric walking tour responding equally to both current events and history.

Departing from The Old Stone House the walk lasts about 1.5 hours and ends at or near the Gowanus Dredgers boathouse and unique food and drink options.

Swoon, Mast, Wolf Tits, and other renowned and street artists are often featured, as are historical landmarks, architectural gems, hidden art spaces, and the work of anonymous "green guerillas" and graffiti artists. While old pollution lingers, so do new issues surrounding gentrification and re-zoning. The area is changing rapidly, and this tour features real-time information & insight. This "socially distant" walk along the water passes historic businesses, hip new bars and cafes, and quirky art and recreational spaces (i.e. shuffleboard, fencing, and ax throwing).

Start time: 11:30 am

End time: 1:00 pm

Contact phone:

Location: Old Stone House (in J.J. Byrne Playground)
location: Old Stone House (in J.J. Byrne Playground)
categories: Art | Tours | Talks | Waterfront | Walking

title: Bilingual Mansion and Grounds Orientation (en Español)
description:
Date: October 9, 2021

The Morris Jumel Mansion dates back to 1765 when it was first built as a summer home for British Colonel Roger Morris, his wife, Mary Philipse, and their family. Throughout the years, many great leaders have stepped foot inside the Morris-Jumel Mansion including Alexander Hamilton, John Adams, Henry Knox and George Washington himself.

Learn more about the history of the house, its architecture, garden, and grounds in this 30 minute outdoor overview. After this 30 minute orientation, the remainder of the tour will be self guided and take place inside the mansion.

An MJM educator will introduce visitors to the exciting history and beautiful grounds surrounding Morris-Jumel Mansion. Free with registration.

—-

La mansión Morris Jumel fue construida en 1765 cuando se construyó por primera vez como casa de verano para el coronel británico Roger Morris, su esposa, Mary Philipse, y su familia.A lo largo de los años, muchos grandes líderes han pisado la mansión Morris-Jumel, entre ellos Alexander Hamilton, John Adams, Henry Knox y el propio George Washington.

Aprenda más sobre la historia de la casa, su arquitectura, jardín y terrenos en esta descripción general al aire libre de 30 minutos. Después de esta orientación de 30 minutos, el resto del recorrido será autoguiado y tendrá lugar dentro de la mansión.

La educadora de la Mansion Jumel presentará a los visitantes la emocionante historia y los hermosos terrenos que rodean la Mansión Morris-Jumel. Gratis con registro.

Start time: 11:30 am

End time: 12:00 pm

Contact phone: (212) 923-8008

Location: Morris-Jumel Mansion (in Roger Morris Park)

title: Traveling Kitchen: Culture
description:
Date: October 9, 2021

Dyckman Farmhouse Museum Educator, Fabiola Cáceres, and political activist and food justice warrior, Karen Washington, meet in the DFM kitchen to prepare Gumbo-A-La-Bronx, an important cultural recipe. Join the pair as they cook and contemplate the history of a dish born in West Africa and popularized during colonial times. They will examine how a recipe can tell the stories of the enslaved West African people and their forced journey to America. Karen will also talk about her upcoming projects.

description:

Please join artist Daniele Frazier as she hosts a live drawing event in Highland Park.

Park-goers of all ages, as well as professional artists, will be provided pencils, charcoal, paper, and clipboards and invited to sketch a model from life. The model will be an actor in a giant bird costume, bringing to life Frazier's public sculpture Big Bird. The real-life giant bird will be posing for 2 hours, allowing visitors time to capture it in various positions.

This is a great opportunity to get outside, meet a local artist, and learn how to draw a bird.

This event is part of the City Artist Corps grant initiative, created to activate and energize New York City’s artists and engage the public with arts activities this summer and fall.

title: Movies Under the Stars: Scoob!
description:
Date: October 9, 2021

Join NYC Parks and New York City Mayor's Office of Media and Entertainment for this free family film!

Scoob!

This hilarious origin story reveals how lifelong friends Scooby and Shaggy first met and how they joined with young detectives Fred, Velma, and Daphne to form the famous Mystery Inc. Now, with hundreds of cases solved and adventures shared, Scooby and the gang face their biggest, most challenging mystery ever: a plot to unleash the ghost dog Cerberus upon the world. As they race to stop this global “dogpocalypse,” the gang discovers that Scooby has a secret legacy and an epic destiny greater than anyone imagined. Rated PG.

Know Before You Go
You should arrive before 6:30 p.m. to get your spot for the movie. Please bring your own picnic blanket or chair. Food is OK, but no alcohol or smoking is permitted. All are welcome!

For everyone's safety, we are asking all participants to observe the following guidelines:

  • Please wear a mask if you are unvaccinated, or if it makes you feel more comfortable
  • All individuals should maintain social distancing of six feet during programming, regardless of vaccination status
  • Please wear a mask if social distancing cannot be maintained
  • Wash your hands before attending a program
  • Stay home if you are sick

Contact (212) 360-1430 or accessibility@parks.nyc.gov for more information regarding accessibility.

Start time: 6:30 pm

End time: 8:00 pm

Contact phone: (718) 965-8942

Location: Col David Marcus Playground (in Colonel David Marcus Playground)
location: Col David Marcus Playground (in Colonel David Marcus Playground)

title: Movies Under the Stars: Jurassic Park
description:
Date: October 9, 2021

Join NYC Parks and the New York City Mayor's Office of Media and Entertainment for a free film.

Genetically engineered dinosaurs run amok on a remote island in this special-effects extravaganza. It's up to a paleontologist, a paleobotanist and a mathematician to outmaneuver the deadly beasts and find their way back to civilization. Based on Michael Crichton's best seller. The film won three Oscars, including Best Visual Effects. Rated PG-13.

Know Before You Go
You should arrive before 6:45 p.m. to get your spot. Feel free to bring a blanket to sit on; there will be a limited supply of chairs available. Bottled water is permitted, but not glass. Reservations are not taken; space is available on a first-come, first-served basis. All are welcome!

title: Phoenix Flow: A festival for the whole family, free and open to the public
description:
Date: October 10, 2021

Phoenix Community Garden is holding Phoenix Flow: a day of wellness, workshops, a marketplace, and live music to celebrate the fall harvest season on Sunday, October 10 from noon to 6:00 p.m.! All is free and everyone is welcome. The garden is located at 2051 Fulton Street in Ocean Hill, Brooklyn.

Festivities include:

  • BBQ lunch
  • Movement workshops of yoga, dance meditations, and belly-dancing for the little ones all the way to our elders.
  • Live musicians featuring Haile Supreme, Zaven, Bri Blvck, Tan Brown, Yvette Williams, and a magic performance by Royal Pain! The last hour will end with an open jam session led by Zaven.
  • Activities: natural printing, making your own tea blend, leaf impressions, bracelet beading and more!
  • Somers Street is blocked off to allow for play - bring your skates, wheels, and toys! We will have a bouncy house.
  • Featured vendors: Marcia's Soaps, Green Tea Co., Ally J's Scents candles, jewelry from Marjani, Shop by R&S and House of Negesti, vintage clothing from Ms. K's things, and more.
  • Raffle for a very special candlelit dinner for four at the garden.

This event is sponsored by GREEN/ARTS LIVE NYC. GREEN / ARTS LIVE NYC is made possible with support from New York Community Trust and Con Edison’s Arts Al Fresco Series, administered by City Parks Foundation in collaboration with the Horticultural Society of New York, New Yorkers for Culture & Arts, NYC Department of Transportation, OpenCultureWORKS, and Street Lab.

Start time: 12:00 pm

End time: 6:00 pm

Contact phone:

Location: Phoenix Community Garden

title: World's Fair History Walk
description:
Date: October 10, 2021

Join us for a free guided World’s Fair History Walk with Alliance for Flushing Meadows Corona Park docent Linda Fisher.

The tour stops at approximately a dozen remaining 1939/40 and 1964/65 World’s Fair sites in the park, from the iconic Unisphere, built by US Steel for the 1964/65 Fair and the New York State Pavilion, with its state-fair-inspired design by Philip Johnson, to lesser-known spectacular spots. You’ll pass what is now Terrace on the Park, but was once the Port Authority pavilion, shaped in a giant T for transportation and, if time allows, the tour will end near the second-oldest outdoor antiquity in New York City, bequeathed to us by the Hashemite Kingdom of Jordan.

All ages welcome. Please wear comfortable shoes and observe mask and social distancing policies. Questions and World’s Fair memories welcome.

Weather permitting.

Start time: 1:00 pm

End time: 2:30 pm

Contact phone: (718) 760-6437

Location: Unisphere (in Flushing Meadows Corona Park)
categories: History | Tours

title: Summer on the Hudson: Overlook Concerts
description:
Date: October 10, 2021

Riverside Park Conservancy and our generous supporters present our Fall 2021 Overlook Concert series, with talent from French Cookin’ Blues, the James “Pony” Kerr Trio, and the Manhattan School of Music Community Partnerships.

September 26 – FRENCH COOKIN’ BLUES - David “Doc” French, Leader - This Blues Hall of Fame band plays authentic New York Blues derived from the Delta to Chicago, Texas and Louisiana, and our own great city.

October 3 – THE JAMES “PONY” KERR TRIO - A wonderful mix of Bluegrass and Delta Blues, this band brings a new sound to our series.

October 10 – MANHATTAN SCHOOL OF MUSIC JAZZ COMBO - The great jazz standards played by a group of talented jazz musicians

Come join us for these sweet Sundays in the park!

title: Con Edison's Family Science
description:
Date: October 10, 2021

We're Back! Live and in-person.... and socially distanced.

We are happy to be able to continue our Con Edison Family Science Night, a series of free monthly sessions featuring science topics and experiments designed for children and parents to accomplish as a team. A few short, self-guided activities will start families thinking together, followed by a take-home activity.

Due to Covid -19 restrictions, this program will take place outdoors and will be limited to 20 participants per 45-minute session. No more than 4 participants per family.

Please be prompt and arrive at your reserved time. We may not be able to accommodate families that show up late.

Registration: By registering for this event, you confirm that you have read our Covid-19 precautions and media consent. The event is free but registration is required.

Location: Meet at the Greenbelt Nature Center.

Public Transportation to Greenbelt Nature Center:

By bus from the Staten Island Ferry Terminal: Take the S62 bus to Bradley Avenue. Transfer to the S57 bus, which will take you to the Brielle and Rockland Ave. stop. Cross the street at the light.By Train from the Staten Island Ferry Terminal: Take the SIRR toward Tottenville, and get off at the New Dorp stop (9 stops). Walk about 1 minute down New Dorp Lane to Rose Avenue and New Dorp Plaza to get on the S57 bus toward Port Richmond. Go about 10 minutes (10 stops) and get off the bus at Rockland Av/Brielle Av. Walk 1 minute to Greenbelt Nature Center.

Cancellation: This program may be canceled if registration is too low, or if there is inclement weather predicted on the day of the event. Please ensure that we have your correct information so that we can contact you in the event of a cancellation. As we receive cancellations, names will be added from the waitlist. If you know you will be unable to attend, please cancel your registration by email at sigreenbelteducation@gmail.com or by phone at (718) 351-3450 ext. 0, so we can fill the reservation.

Media Consent: By registering for this program, you are agreeing to have your image used in promotional materials by the Greenbelt Conservancy, including but not limited to, photographs and video. If you choose not to give consent, please let us know by emailing us atm sigreenbelteducation@gmail.com before the event.

Covid-19 Precautions:

-All Visitors and Staff must wear a mask during the entire event.

-Masks and Hand sanitizer will be available.

-All equipment will be sanitized before and after the event. (will be included if we are using equipment)

-By participating in this event you are acknowledging that you and your guests have not experienced a fever, not tested positive for COVID-19, have not been exposed to anyone with COVID-19 or traveled to a restricted state within 14 days of the event. Should you develop symptoms after registration, please cancel your registration by emailing sigreenbelteducation@gmail.com.

Start time: 2:00 pm

End time: 4:00 pm

Contact phone:

Location: Greenbelt Nature Center (in Blood Root Valley)

title: Movies Under the Stars: Rhymes For Young Ghouls
description:
Date: October 10, 2021

Join NYC Parks and New York City Mayor's Office of Media and Entertainment for this free film!

Rhymes for Young Ghouls

Set in 1976 Canada on the fictional Red Crow Mi'gMaq reservation, this award-winning thriller follows Alia as she plots to escape the government residential school, she’s imprisoned in. Based on the history of abuse of the First Nations people by government agents, including a large number of reported cases of the mental and physical abuse of residential school children. Rated R.

Know Before You Go
This film is rated R and contains explicit content intended for mature audiences. You should arrive by 6:30 p.m. to get your spot for the movie. Please bring your own picnic blanket or chair. Food is OK, but no alcohol or smoking is permitted. All are welcome!

title: Movies Under the Stars: Cruella
description:
Date: October 10, 2021

Join NYC Parks and New York City Mayor's Office of Media and Entertainment for this free film!

Emma Stone (LA LA LAND) stars in Disney’s CRUELLA, a live-action feature film about the rebellious early days of one of cinema’s most notorious – and notoriously fashionable – villains, the legendary Cruella de Vil. Set during the 1970s punk rock revolution in London, the story follows a clever and creative young grifter named Estella, who is determined to become a successful designer. After Estella befriends a pair of young thieves who appreciate her appetite for mischief, the three build a life for themselves on the London streets. Before long, Estella’s flair for fashion catches the eye of the Baroness von Hellman, a devastatingly chic and terrifyingly haute fashion legend, played by Emma Thompson (HOWARDS END, SENSE AND SENSIBILITY). But their relationship sets in motion a course of events and revelations that will cause Estella to embrace her wicked side and become the raucous, fashionable and revenge-bent Cruella. Rated PG-13.

Know Before You Go

You should arrive by 6:30 p.m. to get your spot for the movie. Please bring your own picnic blanket or chair. Food is OK, but no alcohol or smoking is permitted. All are welcome!

title: Bayswater Fall Festival
description:
Date: October 11, 2021

Join Council Member Selvena Brooks-Power and Queens Recreation as they present their annual Fall Festival in Bayswater Park. This fun day of family activities will feature inflatables, popcorn, fall- and Halloween-themed arts & crafts and games, fitness challenges, prizes, an animal educator, and a Pumpkin Patch with free pumpkins while supplies last.

Know Before You Go:

For everyone's safety, we are asking all participants to observe the following guidelines:

  • Please wear a mask if you are unvaccinated, or if it makes you feel more comfortable
  • All individuals should maintain social distancing of six feet during programming, regardless of vaccination status
  • Please wear a mask if social distancing cannot be maintained
  • Wash your hands before attending a program
  • Stay home if you are sick

Start time: 12:00 pm

End time: 4:00 pm

description:

Members of the South Shore Artists Group created an engaging and interactive mural entitled "The Perfect Sea" to educate children and adults about the sea and its ecology; in particular, how pollution affects sea life in our local waters.

The exhibition will be on display at the Lenape Gallery at the Conference House Park Visitors Center through the end of the year.

Free admission.

All current COVID-19 protocols to be followed

title: Exhibit: Fire and Tide - Terra Marine Inn: A Brief History of Huguenot Park, Staten Island
description:
Date: October 12, 2021

Explore a bit of Staten Island's past and history.

The Fire and Tide exhibition explores the history of the former turn of the century Terra Marine Inn. This hotel was a wonderful piece of Staten Island gilded past. The exhibit combines history and original artwork focusing on the bygone location.

Free admission. Exhibit on display through December.

All COVID-19 protocols to be followed.

Start time: 10:00 am

title: Fall Volunteer Days at the Bronx River Foodway
description:
Date: October 12, 2021

Lend a hand and connect with community and friends during our upcoming First Saturdays at the Foodway programming! Support morning stewardship, which includes gardening and beautifying of New York City's only edible food forest. Join us as well for some tours around our food forest, where we discuss the value of these herbs and veggies for both our health and the environment.

Hand sanitizer, masks, gloves, social distancing guidelines, and temperature checks provided to prevent the spread of Covid-19.

Thank you for being interested in volunteering with the Bronx River Alliance. You are committing to a special effort during a special time.

Please review the NYC Guidelines for Volunteering in Parks during COVID:

  • Stay home if sick (e.g., running a fever, coughing, experiencing loss of taste or smell, or other Covid-19 symptoms)
  • Maintain 6 feet of distance
  • Wash hands and clean surfaces frequently
  • Wear face coverings

Start time: 10:00 am

End time: 12:00 pm

title: Watercolor Workshops
description:
Date: October 12, 2021

Join us for a watercolor painting workshop series in partnership with Seeds of the League. Artist Kenneth Fitzpatrick will teach you how to draw and paint using nature as your inspiration. Learn about light, color, and design while making art en plein air (outside). All levels from beginners to advanced are welcome.For your comfort, bring a mat or chair.About the artist:Kenneth Fitzpatrick, a graduate of the High School of Art & Design, was born and raised in New York City. His awards include P.S. Art, a citywide competition for pre-K to 12, culminating in an exhibition at the Metropolitan Museum of Art and a Seeds of the League Scholarship. Ken’s work focuses on compositional storytelling using the mediums of oils, graphite, watercolors, tattoos, and digital art. His goals include finishing his degree in game development and encouraging others to pursue their art.

Start time: 10:00 am

End time: 12:00 pm

Contact phone:

title: River Project: Wetlab Look-Ins
description:

Our flow-through aquarium houses dozens of species of fish and invertebrates all caught within the Park as part of an ongoing ecological survey. Park staff will be available for tours and questions during the duration of open hours. If you can't make it to Pier 40, we will also be live streaming feeding and/or species spotlights each day on Facebook live @hudsonriverpark.

Animals are released each season to ensure that their behaviors and life cycles are minimally impacted.

Please make sure to bring a mask if you are attending in person.

title: Summer on the Hudson: Moving For Life
description:
Date: October 12, 2021

Moving for Life is a gentle workout that begins with breathing exercises, then moves into active aerobic dancing that strengthens body awareness.

Pre-registration for the event is required. Management reserves the right to cap participation in accordance with current COVID-19 outdoor safety guidelines.

Please register online.

Please note: We are offering outdoor programs with limited attendance so that you can have a safe and enjoyable time in parks. Based on New York State guidance for outdoor events during COVID-19, we’ve put protocols into place to keep our participants and staff safe and healthy. We're asking everyone to help us stay safe.

Know Before You Go:

For everyone's safety, we are asking all participants to observe the following guidelines:

  • Please wear a mask if you are unvaccinated, or if it makes you feel more comfortable
  • All individuals should maintain social distancing of six feet during programming, regardless of vaccination status
  • Please wear a mask if social distancing cannot be maintained
  • Wash your hands before attending a program
  • Stay home if you are sick

Additionally, we encourage participants to bring their own hand sanitizer to our programs.

Start time: 5:30 pm

End time: 6:30 pm

Contact phone: (212) 870-3070

title: Land Markings: Brooklyn, Virtual Artist Talk
description:
Date: October 12, 2021

Join us for a virtual closing conversation with co-curator Katherine Gressel and artists Jeremy Dennis and Ella Mahoney from our contemporary art exhibition Land Markings. Land Markings brings together four New York-based artists of Indigenous heritage who have created site-specific work commenting on the past, present, and future of land use in the areas surrounding the Old Stone House; and land use issues facing contemporary Indigenous and other BIPOC communities. The artists will discuss their original work created for this exhibition focusing on Brooklyn’s Indigenous past and visions for its decolonized future.

Shinnecock Nation-enrolled tribal member and artist Jeremy Dennis’ On This Site: Indigenous Long Island photos and interactive website call attention to Brooklyn’s culturally significant Native American sites and the continued presence of Native people today. Through his work, Dennis hopes to contribute to “communal awareness and cultural enlightenment, which leads to cultural critique, historical inquiry, and educational development”.

Ella Mahoney draws from her Aquinnah Wampanoag background to imagine a decolonized future for the Gowanus, in light of its planned rezoning. A series of new painted banners created for OSH, on view alongside older work about her own community’s ties to the natural environment, explore “what the space could be if we healed our relationship to the land and water.”

Learn more about the exhibition and artist bios here and view a virtual tour here.

Start time: 7:15 pm

End time: 8:45 pm

Contact phone:

Location: Old Stone House (in J.J. Byrne Playground)
location: Old Stone House (in J.J. Byrne Playground)
categories: Art | Talks | Indigenous Peoples' Day

title: Haunted History: Spirits of the Merchant’s House, Past & Present
description:
Date: October 13, 2021

Inexplicable and unsettling occurrences began immediately after Gertrude, the last surviving member of the Tredwell family, died in the house, in 1933. They haven’t stopped.

We invite you to venture into the dark and ghostly shadows of history – virtually, from the safety of your home – to hear true stories of the strange and chilling happenings over the Museum’s eight decades. You’ll also learn about the methods and findings of past paranormal investigations – and the startling results of current research conducted in 2020, while the museum was closed due to COVID-19. The house was empty – or was it?

After the presentation, join paranormal investigator Dan Sturges for a Q&A.

Start time: 6:00 pm

End time: 7:00 pm

Contact phone: (212) 777-1089

title: Poetic People Power presents: Can You Hear Me Now?
description:
Date: October 13, 2021

Spoken word artist Tara Bracco will introduce and present a video of Poetic People Power’s show Can You Hear Me Now?

Bracco founded Poetic People Power in 2003 to combine poetry and activism. This show brings feminist voices to the forefront as poets explore what it means to be heard in their personal lives and at a national level. Cast members are Tara Bracco, Shetal Shah, Shanelle Gabriel, Angela Kariotis, Karla Jackson-Brewer, and Suzen Baraka.

Commissioned by Susan Grabel and Stefany Benson in conjunction with the Don't Shut Up exhibition, the program is made possible in part by a DCA Art Fund grant from Staten Island Arts, with public support from the New York City Department of Cultural Affairs.

Don’t Shut Up 2021 is made possible through generous support from the Samuel I. Newhouse Foundation, the New York State Council on the Arts, with the support of of the Governor of New York, the New York State Legislature, and the New York City Department of Cultural Affairs in partnership with the City Council. Additional support provided in part by a DCA Art Fund grant from Staten Island Arts, with public support from the New York City Department of Cultural Affairs.

Start time: 7:00 pm

End time: 8:00 pm

Contact phone: (718) 425-3515

Location: Virtual/Online Workshop

Free admission. Exhibit on display through December.

All COVID-19 protocols to be followed.

title: River Project: Live From the Field
description:
Date: October 14, 2021

Wildlife thrives all over NYC, especially in HRPK's waters! Tune into @HudsonRiverPark's Instagram Live for an insider’s look into the Park's Estuarine Sanctuary as we study environmental DNA, analyze microplastics, sample fish populations and so much more!

HRPK's River Project conducts research and offers hands-on environmental education and scientific programming with the purpose of communicating the ecological importance of the Park’s 400-acre Estuarine Sanctuary. Dedicated to community engagement, stewardship and learning, the River Project offers at-home STEM activities, tours of marine-biology stations and other educational resources to support scientific understanding of the Lower Hudson Estuary.

title: River Project: Wetlab Look-Ins
description:
Date: October 14, 2021

Our flow-through aquarium houses dozens of species of fish and invertebrates all caught within the Park as part of an ongoing ecological survey. Park staff will be available for tours and questions during the duration of open hours. If you can't make it to Pier 40, we will also be live streaming feeding and/or species spotlights each day on Facebook live @hudsonriverpark.

Animals are released each season to ensure that their behaviors and life cycles are minimally impacted.

Please make sure to bring a mask if you are attending in person.

Start time: 3:00 pm

End time: 6:00 pm

Contact phone: (212) 627-2020

title: Jazz Concert: Gabriel Chakarji Trio
description:
Date: October 14, 2021

Join NYC Parks and Council Member Ben Kallos for a free afternoon of jazz in the park!

Gabriel Chakarji is a Latin Grammy Award nominee pianist and composer who merges his Venezuelan music background with the sounds of New York City Jazz.

This event is FREE and open to the public.

Get tickets

Know Before You Go:

For everyone's safety, we are asking all participants to observe the following guidelines:

  • Please wear a mask if you are unvaccinated, or if it makes you feel more comfortable
  • All individuals should maintain social distancing of six feet during programming, regardless of vaccination status
  • Please wear a mask if social distancing cannot be maintained
  • Wash your hands before attending a program
  • Stay home if you are sick

For accessibility information, contact (212) 360-1430 or accessibility@parks.nyc.gov.

This event is sponsored by Council Member Ben Kallos.

title: Movies Under the Stars: Forbidden Planet
description:
Date: October 14, 2021

Join NYC Parks and the New York City Mayor's Office of Media and Entertainment for a free film!

Grab a blanket and come enjoy a movie in a neighborhood park or playground! Movies begin at dusk. You should arrive before 6:00 p.m. to get your spot. This event is FREE and open to the public, but seating is limited. Reservations are not taken.

Forbidden Planet

Bring your best sci-fi costume and watch this classic movie with us!

A starship crew goes to investigate the silence of a planet's colony only to find two survivors and a deadly secret that one of them has. Rated G.

Know Before You Go:

For everyone's safety, we are asking all participants to observe the following guidelines:

  • Please wear a mask if you are unvaccinated, or if it makes you feel more comfortable
  • All individuals should maintain social distancing of six feet during programming, regardless of vaccination status
  • Please wear a mask if social distancing cannot be maintained
  • Wash your hands before attending a program
  • Stay home if you are sick

Glass bottles and alcoholic beverages are strictly prohibited.

Contact (212) 360-1430 or accessibility@parks.nyc.gov for more information regarding accessibility.

title: Concert:  Rene McLean & Music of the Spirit, Bertha Hope 5tet, Baba Don Babatunde
description:
Date: October 14, 2021

Rene McLean & Music of the SpiritRene McLean is a renowned saxophonist, composer, band leader, and educator who began his musical training under the tutelage of his father, the great Jackie McLean, and started leading his own bands at age 16. He's performed and recorded with the creme de la creme of Black Musical tradition: Dizzy Gillespie, Tito Puente, Babatunde Olatunji, Miriam Makeba, Abbey Lincoln, Dexter Gordon, and poet-activist Amiri Baraka. He is on the faculty of the Jackie McLean Institute at The Hartt School.Bertha Hope 5tetFamed pianist Bertha Hope has toured with artists Nat Adderley, Dizzy Gillespie and Eddie Henderson, while an accomplished educator and bandleader in her own right. In 2018 she won the National Jazz Museum in Harlem's Legends of Jazz Award. Baba Don BabatundePercussionist Baba Don Babatunde worked with various artists in the jazz idiom, R&B, and most African-derived percussion styles, while a longtime featured member of the esteemed Last Poets.

Start time: 6:00 pm

End time: 8:30 pm

title: Musical Ecologies with Dafna Naphtali
description:
Date: October 14, 2021

Musical Ecologies returns to in-person events with Brooklyn-based composer/performer Dafna Naphtali. Audience limited to 25, proof of vaccination required for entry. Please wear a mask.

A native New Yorker, Dafna Naphtali is well-known as a vocalist, electronic musician, and sound artist. For tonight’s program, she will perform works involving live sound processing, voice, algorithmic studies, downsized versions of her multichannel sound and sound-walking pieces, and improvisations, all drawing on work created and developed over 20+ years. With special guest, percussionist Danny Tunick. The evening will begin with a conversation hosted by series curator Dan Joseph.

Founded in 2012, Musical Ecologies is a monthly symposium on music and sound held at the Old Stone House in Park Slope, Brooklyn. Curated and hosted by composer Dan Joseph, each event focuses on a single artist, who presents a recent work or project in the form of a talk or lecture, a multimedia presentation, a performance, or combination thereof. Each presentation is preceded by an extended conversation between the artist and curator.

About the artist:

Dafna Naphtali is a singer/instrumentalist/electronic-musician who composes/performs experimental, interactive electro-acoustic music, drawing on a wide-ranging musical background in jazz, classical, rock, and near-eastern music and using her custom Max/MSP programming. She has performed in the US, Canada, Europe, India, Russia, and the Middle East. Current projects include “Audio Chandelier”, a multi-channel audio work presented in New York, Berlin, and Montreal, “Robotica” (music robots and voice), and her audio augmented reality soundwalks “Walkie Talkie Dream Angles”. Dafna’s has long-running projects in live sound-processing of voice and acoustic instruments, as her a performable “instrument”. The current focus is on duos with acoustic instrumentalists such as pianist Gordon Beeferman, trombonist Jen Baker (Clip Mouth Unit), percussionist Luis Tabuenca, Chuck Bettis, saxophonist/multi-instrumentalist Ras Moshe, saxophonist Edith Lettner, and a longtime duo with Hans Tammen (Buchla, endangered guitar). Fellowships/awards include NY Foundation for the Arts, NY State Council on the Arts, Brooklyn Arts Council, Franklin Furnace, American Composers Forum, Foundation for Contemporary Arts, American Music Center; residencies: Music/OMI, STEIM, and Signal Culture.

Start time: 8:00 pm

End time: 10:00 pm

Contact phone:

Location: Old Stone House (in J.J. Byrne Playground)

Choose from dozens of bulb varieties for autumn planting that will bring color, fragrance, and excitement to your garden--like tulips, daffodils and many varieties of smaller bulbs. Your Autumn Bulb Sale purchases will help fund Snug Harbor’s horticulture program and beautiful botanical gardens.

PRE-ORDER

View photos and bulb descriptions in the 2021 Autumn Bulb Sale Catalog

WHERE TO PICK UP: Pick up bulb pre-orders and buy additional bulbs onsite at the P1 parking lot, closest to the East Gate at Fillmore and Tysen Streets. (Site map here)

title: Greenbelt Adult Hike: The Overlook
description:
Date: October 15, 2021

Join us for a hike through the heart of High Rock Park. We will stroll past ponds and to the Overlook, which gives a beautiful view of the Richmond County Golf course greens and the ocean beyond. Trails have some inclines and are not paved. The hike is approx. two hours. Bring water and wear sturdy shoes/boots.

Designed for adults ages 18+ who want to spend time in nature, get healthy exercise, and more! Face masks and social distancing a must.

Registration: By registering for this event, you confirm that you have read our Covid-19 precautions and media consent. The event is free but registration is required.

Gear: Wear clothes you don’t mind getting dirty, long, light-colored pants are preferred. Closed-toe shoes (sneakers or boots) are required. Please bring water, sunscreen, and insect repellent.

Cancellation: This program may be canceled if registration is too low, or if there is inclement weather predicted on the day of the event. Please ensure that we have your correct information so that we can contact you in the event of a cancellation. As we receive cancellations, names will be added from the waitlist. If you know you will be unable to attend, please cancel your registration by emailing sigreenbelteducation@gmail.com or calling (718) 351-3450 ext. 0, so we can fill the reservation.

Media Consent: By registering for this program, you are agreeing to have your image used in promotional materials by the Greenbelt Conservancy, including but not limited to, photographs and video. If you choose not to give consent, please let us know by emailing us at sigreenbelteducation@gmail.com before the event.

Covid-19 Precautions:

- All Visitors and Staff must wear a mask during the entire event.

- Masks and hand sanitizer will be available.

- All equipment will be sanitized before and after the event. (will be included if we are using equipment)

- By participating in this event you are acknowledging that you and your guests have not experienced a fever, not tested positive for COVID-19, and have not been exposed to anyone with COVID-19 within 14 days of the event. Should you develop symptoms after registration, please cancel your registration by emailing sigreenbelteducation@gmail.com

Start time: 11:00 am

End time: 1:00 pm

Contact phone:

Location: High Rock Parking Lot (in High Rock Park)
location: High Rock Parking Lot (in High Rock Park)

title: Highbridge Film Festival: In the Heights
description:
Date: October 15, 2021

Join NYC Parks and the New York City Mayor's Office of Media and Entertainment for a free film!

In the Heights

A film version of the Broadway musical in which Usnavi, a sympathetic New York bodega owner, saves every penny every day as he imagines and sings about a better life. PG-13

Grab a blanket and snuggle up for this year’s Fall Film Festival at Highbridge Pool Deck. NYC Parks will host a series of movie screenings accompanied by fun and exciting activities fit for the whole family.

Check what will happen on Fridays

September 24, 2021

5:30 p.m. // Scavenger Hunt

7:00 p.m. // Dora and the Last City of Gold

October 1, 2021

6:00 p.m. // Dance Cardio Class

7:00 p.m. // Selena

October 8, 2021

6:00 p.m. // Arts & Crafts

7:00 p.m. // Coco

October 15, 2021

4:00 p.m. // Block Party

7:00 p.m. // In the Heights

Know Before You Go:

For everyone's safety, we are asking all participants to observe the following guidelines:

  • Please wear a mask if you are unvaccinated, or if it makes you feel more comfortable
  • All individuals should maintain social distancing of six feet during programming, regardless of vaccination status
  • Please wear a mask if social distancing cannot be maintained
  • Wash your hands before attending a program
  • Stay home if you are sick

Glass bottles and alcoholic beverages are strictly prohibited.

Contact (212) 360-1430 or accessibility@parks.nyc.gov for more information regarding accessibility.

Start time: 4:00 pm

End time: 10:00 pm

Contact phone: (212) 408-0243

title: Watercolor Workshop
description:
Date: October 15, 2021

Join us for a watercolor painting workshop series in partnership with Seeds of the League. Artist Kenneth Fitzpatrick will teach you how to draw and paint using nature as your inspiration. Learn about light, color, and design while making art en plein air (outside). All levels from beginners to advanced are welcome.For your comfort, bring a mat or chair.About the artist:Kenneth Fitzpatrick, a graduate of the High School of Art & Design, was born and raised in New York City. His awards include P.S. Art, a citywide competition for pre-K to 12, culminating in an exhibition at the Metropolitan Museum of Art and a Seeds of the League Scholarship. Ken’s work focuses on compositional storytelling using the mediums of oils, graphite, watercolors, tattoos, and digital art. His goals include finishing his degree in game development and encouraging others to pursue their art.

Start time: 4:00 pm

End time: 6:00 pm

Contact phone:

Location: Austin J. McDonald Playground
categories: Arts & Crafts | Art | Arts, Culture & Fun Series

description:
Date: October 15, 2021

Join NYC Parks and New York City Mayor's Office of Media and Entertainment at SHOCKTOBERFEST with these spooky films!

Scary Stories to Tell in the Dark

This 2019 horror follows Stella and her two friends as they discover a notebook of sinister stories by Sarah Bellows, a tortured teen. These terrifying tales soon have a way of becoming all too real for a group of unsuspecting teens who stumble upon Sarah's spooky home. Rated PG-13.

title: Movies Under the Stars: Bill & Ted Face the Music
description:
Date: October 15, 2021

Join NYC Parks and New York City Mayor's Office of Media and Entertainment for this free film!

Aspiring 1990s high school musicians Bill S. Preston and Ted Logan are now middle-aged dads. When the Great Leader visits them to ask about the song they were supposed to compose to save all of humanity, the two are at a loss. Given a new pressing deadline to create this song, they ride their trusted telephone booth and time-travel into the future to retrieve this savior song from the people who have it – their future selves. Rated PG-13.

title: Summer on the Hudson: Forest Bathing
description:
Date: October 16, 2021

Forest Therapy or Forest Bathing comes from the traditions of Shinrin Yoku and other European and indigenous cultures. We invite you to join us in reconnecting with nature by participating in a guided Forest Bathing experience. Allow yourself to connect with the park in a way you never have before. The program includes a short, no more than a half-mile walk at a slow pace.

Participants are encouraged to wear comfortable clothing and bring water, snacks, and a towel or cushion for sitting on the ground.

Participants will meet in front of River Run Playground at 83rd St. at 9:00 a.m. in Riverside Park. The guide will be wearing a purple and white backpack and will be stationed at the playground entrance.

Register for the event here.

title: Sustain-a-ween & Volunteer Landscaping at Schmul Park
description:
Date: October 16, 2021

Join the Freshkills Park Alliance and NYC Parks Department for a Sustain-a-ween workshop and volunteer day at Schmul Park.

Decorations that end up in a landfill, never to biodegrade are scary. Did you know you can bypass the waste and enjoy Halloween through upcycling? Join us for a short upcycling workshop, while we learn about the different ecology that get more attention this time of year, like spiders, bats, snakes, and more! In the meantime check out these 5 Sustain-a-ween zero-waste activities to try at home.

Afterward, we will lay our garden bed to rest, to ensure our recently planted Daffodil Project bulbs and established perennials to rise in the spring! We will mulch around our native plants, which helps to insulate the soil, conserve water, and prevent invasive weeds from returning. In addition, we will use wood chips to create an edge for our garden. Utilizing discarded organic matter to improve the conditions for our pollinator garden is a sustainable approach to help the local native pollinators.

Together, let's make this black and orange holiday a little greener!

Gear: Wear clothes you don't mind getting dirty, long pants are preferred. Closed-toe shoes like sneakers or boots are required. Please also bring water and sunblock. Gardening gloves will be provided.

Technology: Feel free to take photos, but consider carefully before bringing any electronic devices with you as they may possibly get wet, damaged, or dropped during the program.

Restrictions: You will be asked to sign an activity waiver before participating in the program. Participants must be Ages 14+. Participants under 18 will require a parent or guardian's signature. Waivers will be emailed with confirmation emails closer to the event.

Cancellation: This event will be canceled if registration is too low, or if there is a 60% or greater chance of rain on the day of the event. You will be asked to confirm your registration by email before the event. As we receive cancellations, names will be added from the waitlist. If you know you will be unable to attend, please cancel your registration by emailing info@freshkillspark.org so we can fill the reservation.

Covid-19 Precautions:

This event will follow the current NYC Parks safety guidelines, which can be found here.

Masks, Gloves, and Hand sanitizer will be available.

By participating in this event you are acknowledging that you and your guests have not experienced a fever, not tested positive for COVID-19, and have not been exposed to anyone with COVID-19 within 14 days of the event. Should you develop symptoms after registration, please cancel your registration by emailing info@freshkillspark.org.

Can't make it? You can still help by promoting our volunteer projects with your friends and neighbors. Students can receive credit for community service hours. We will also be adding more volunteer opportunities as the season continues.

Start time: 9:00 am

End time: 12:00 pm

Contact phone: (929) 481-2795

Location: Schmul Park
categories: Arts & Crafts | Nature | Volunteer | Halloween | Workshops

title: Hellgate Farm Stand
description:
Date: October 16, 2021

Every Saturday at Socrates in the spring, summer, fall, Hellgate Farm offers fresh seasonal local produce and small batch goods, like their signature hot sauce. Cash, credit card and Venmo are accepted, plus Supplemental Nutrition Assistance Program (SNAP), Farmers’ Market Nutrition Program (FMNP), and Health Bucks. Wilk Apiaries also pops up on select Saturdays to vend their variety of local and raw honeys.

About Hellgate Farm

Hellgate Farm is a network of residential and rooftop gardens in Queens, NYC. The farm aims to promote urban gardening and a permaculture lifestyle within their local community, providing opportunities for people interested in these practices to connect and learn, as well as share in the abundance of the harvest.

title: Ocean Breeze Green Team Volunteer Event
description:
Date: October 16, 2021

Ocean Breeze Park is a beautiful 140-acre park consisting of wetlands, grasslands, and shrub forests. This area is home to innumerable species of wildlife needing your caring hands as we work together in stewardship and restoration of our beloved park. Volunteers will be participating in hands-on projects in our park and green spaces. This may include trail maintenance, clean-up projects, invasive weed removal, planting, and other environmental projects. Further information will be provided upon registration.

Fall 2021 Green Team Dates:

  • Saturday, October 2: 10am – noon
  • Saturday, October 9: 10am – noon
  • Saturday, October 16: 10am – noon
  • Saturday, October 23: 10am – noon
  • Sunday, October 24: 10am – noon
  • Saturday, November 13: 10am – noon

The Ocean Breeze Green Team includes environmental and stewardship projects for volunteers in the trails and at the facility. Tasks will include hands-on work like planting, mulching, debris removal, shoveling, crafting, and more. Equipment for the volunteer project will be provided, but we ask if you have lawn and garden gloves to please bring them with you.

Register at oceanbreezenyc.org/greenteam

Start time: 10:00 am

End time: 12:00 pm

Contact phone: (718) 351-7923

Location: Ocean Breeze Track & Field Athletic Complex (in Ocean Breeze Park)

title: Open House New York: Dyckman Farmhouse
description:
Date: October 16, 2021

Visit the Dyckman Farmhouse!

Self-guided tours of the house and the Hessian Hut are free of cost.

The Dyckman Farmhouse is a historic gem, the last farmhouse in Manhattan dating from 1784, with beautiful surrounding gardens and a Revolutionary War-era Military Hut. Enjoy a walk or sip a cup of coffee while enjoying this small green space in bustling Inwood nature. Be sure to check out the kitchen garden, which showcases historic native plants and crops used by Lenape and enslaved African people.

The public has to show proof of vaccination and ID and wear a mask at all times to enter the house. However, to visit the gardens, proof of immunization is not required.

Start time: 10:00 am

End time: 2:00 pm

title: Art Scavengers with Janice Patrignani
description:
Date: October 16, 2021

Take part in the restorative process of creating from nature while surrounded by nature. Take a walk on one of the inspiring trails near the Greenbelt Nature Center, find/collect materials such as twigs, pods, pine cones, or pebbles, then arrange/glue your found objects to a base to create a small mosaic piece for yourself and make components for a collectively made natural mural. Participants will have the option of working social distance style on the outside patio of the Greenbelt Nature Center or pick up a supply packet and watch a video for instructions to create their pieces individually.

This project is funded in part by a DCA Art Fund Grant from Staten Island Arts with public funding from the NYC Department of Cultural Affairs.

Age 5+. Free.

Start time: 10:30 am

End time: 12:30 pm

Contact phone: (718) 351-3450
