title: Central Park Youth Basketball Clinics
description:
Date: October 16, 2021

Enhance your basketball skills through small group instruction and competitive games.

It's not just shooting hoops! Our high-energy, interactive youth basketball clinics cultivate skill development, team play, and sportsmanship both on and off the court. Players aged 6–14 are encouraged to join us on Saturdays and Sundays from July 10 to August 28, 2021. From September 11 to October 30, 2021, clinics will be held on Saturdays only. FREE and open to players of all levels. On-site registration each day on a first-come, first-served basis.

Ages 6–10
11:00 a.m. – 11:30 a.m.: Check In
11:30 a.m. – 12:30 p.m.: Basketball Clinic

Ages 11–14
12:30 p.m. – 1:00 p.m.: Check In
1:00 p.m. – 2:30 p.m.: Basketball Clinic

In case of inclement weather, call (347) 443-0656 to confirm cancellation on the day.

COVID-19 HEALTH AND SAFETY POLICIES

Ensuring the health and safety of our guests, staff, and the public is our top priority. Central Park Conservancy programs follow recommended guidelines from the Centers for Disease Control and Prevention, New York State, and New York City and have adopted enhanced cleaning procedures to ensure a safe playing environment.

This year’s Youth Basketball Clinics ask unvaccinated players to:

  • wear face masks that completely cover their nose and mouth for the duration of the program.
  • complete an on-site health assessment and temperature check prior to playing.

Regardless of vaccination status, all players should continue to monitor themselves for COVID-19 symptoms and stay home if they feel unwell.

Read about policies related to COVID-19, inclement weather, and more on our Frequently Asked Questions page.

Please fill out the Health Assessment form prior to attending the program.

Start time: 11:00 am

End time: 2:30 pm

Contact phone: (347) 443-0656

Location: North Meadow Recreation Center (in Central Park)
location: North Meadow Recreation Center (in Central Park)
categories: Best for Kids | Sports

title: Farmhouse Family Day: Lovely Leaves
description:
Date: October 16, 2021

Let’s explore how leaves change from bright green to warm orange in just a matter of weeks during our October Farmhouse Family Day. Stop by and join us in creating textured leaf prints to get a closer look into the structure of many different leaves. Feel free to stay for a tour of our historic house or just to play with some outdoor colonial games and toys. Family Day takes place from 11:00 a.m. to 3:00 p.m., with the textured leaf print activity beginning at 1:00 p.m.

What to expect on your visit:

  • Farmhouse Family Day is free and open to all ages, ideal for children ages 4-10.
  • The textured leaf printing activity will begin at 1:00 p.m.
  • Farm activities (i.e. harvesting, weeding) are limited, first-come, first-served basis beginning at noon. Make sure to wear close-toed shoes and prepare to get dirty.

Other things to do while you are here:

  • Stop by our Farm stand (from 11:00 a.m. - 3:00 p.m.) featuring Wyckoff Farm fresh veggies and herbs as well as neighborhood vendors.
  • Sign up for a “Sunflower Vegetable Share” food box, a low-cost seasonal fruit and vegetable share, accepting EBT/SNAP.
  • Drop off food scraps for compost.

HEALTH & SAFETY

  • We respectfully ask that all visitors (over the age of 2 years) adhere to mask wearing and social distancing requirements while visiting the museum. Following these protocols will also help protect those who are unvaccinated, including families who visit with young children.
  • Hand sanitizer will be available throughout the park and event. We will have extra masks if you do not bring your own.
  • We recommend using the restroom before your arrival. There is one port-o-san on the property.

Start time: 11:00 am

End time: 3:00 pm

Contact phone: (718) 629-5400

Location: Wyckoff Farmhouse Museum (in Fidler-Wyckoff House Park)
location: Wyckoff Farmhouse Museum (in Fidler-Wyckoff House Park)

title: Sustainable Home Fair
description:
Date: October 16, 2021

Homeowners, renters, building owners, and managers are invited to a Sustainable Home Fair.

Come meet experts to learn about all the cool and fascinating ways you can lower your home's carbon footprint and energy bills, finance it all, and help save the planet. Meet sustainability game-changers all day, who will share their expertise in facing our climate challenge.

New York and other cities around the globe are on a path to cut Green House Gas emissions by the Paris Accord Targets. This commitment is enshrined in NY State's CLCPA. (Climate Leadership and Community Protection Act) and NY City's CMA (Climate Mobilization Act.)

Expert green presentations every hour, including the following products and practices:

-Solar Energy
-Clean Heating & Cooling
-Passive Homes & Home Insulation
-Green Roofs & Rain Barrels
-Electric Ranges & Household Energy Efficiency
-Urban Farming, Composting, and more

Start time: 11:00 am

End time: 5:00 pm

title: Open House New York: Historic Houses of Conference House Park
description:
Date: October 16, 2021

Conference House Park is a great destination for both park and history buffs. Located at the southernmost point of New York State, this park houses several historic buildings that trace the history of the borough over the course of three centuries. Three of these will be open to the public for the 2021 Open House New York Weekend: the Conference House, the Biddle House, and the Rutan-Becket House.

In addition to its historic landmarks and its breathtaking views of Raritan Bay, the 265-acre park boasts a newly refurbished playground, a Visitors Center, expanded paths, and hiking and biking trails. Another great park destination is the “South Pole,” marking the southernmost point of New York State. Art exhibitions and galleries within each house will be open.

Covid-19 protocols will be followed.

Masks required inside houses.

Start time: 12:00 pm

End time: 4:00 pm

Contact phone: (917) 886-4389

Location: Conference House Park Visitor Center (in Conference House Park)
location: Conference House Park Visitor Center (in Conference House Park)
categories: Art | History | Tours | Seniors | Open House New York

title: Exhibit Opening: Rooted in Place
description:
Date: October 16, 2021

Staten Island artist Lisa Dahl premieres paintings that focus on the idea of our homes, communities, and our ties with nature and each other. The newly updated exhibition space is located in the Rutan-Becket House on the grounds of Conference House Park. The imagery of houses combined with the organic patterns of nature creates a synergy with the surroundings of the park and its historic buildings.

This exhibition received support from the New York City Artist Corps.

Free admission. Masks required. All current COVID-19 protocols to be followed.

Start time: 12:00 pm

End time: 4:00 pm

Contact phone: (917) 417-6917

Location: Rutan-Becket House (in Conference House Park)
categories: Art | History | Seniors

title: Fort Tryon Kids: Awesome Arachnids
description:
Date: October 16, 2021

Join the Fort Tryon Park Trust and experts from the Alley Pond Environmental Center for this FREE nature program!

What is an arthropod? What is the difference between an insect and an arachnid? What are spinnerets and who uses them? This exciting lesson teaches students to distinguish between insects and arachnids based on their physical characteristics. Kids learn what arachnids have in common and see a live tarantula up close.

For ages 4 years old and older.

Please note: Space is limited and RSVP is required. Please register on Eventbrite.

This program is generously supported by the Greenacre Foundation and the Fort Tryon Park Trust.

Photo by Joshua Bright of NY Times

title: Drawing Onsite in Inwood Hill Park with Shelley Haven – FREE to Attend!
description:
Date: October 16, 2021

Join the Fort Tryon Park Trust and Shelley Haven at Muscota Marsh in Inwood Hill Park. Experience nature anew with artist’s eyes. Gain insights into selecting and framing your subject, create an artwork with her guidance and encouragement during the working session, then share a viewing of participants’ artworks.

Class size is limited to 15 registered participants.

title: Movies Under the Stars: Under the Subway Video Art Night
description:
Date: October 16, 2021

Join NYC Parks and the New York City Mayor's Office of Media and Entertainment for a free film!

Grab a blanket or a chair for the 20th edition of Under the Subway Video Art Night with over 30 videos curated by Antonio Ortuño. From its first edition in 2011, USVAN has distinguished itself by welcoming digital art videos of an experimental and performative nature. Since its inception, we have opened the door to disciplines that are different and unlike each other, but interrelated, thus raising awareness that video art is live art.

title: Open House New York: Historic Houses of Conference House Park
description:
Date: October 17, 2021

Conference House Park is a great destination for both park and history buffs. Located at the southernmost point of New York State, this park houses several historic buildings that trace the history of the borough over the course of three centuries. Three of these will be open to the public for the 2021 Open House New York Weekend: the Conference House, the Biddle House, and the Rutan-Becket House.

In addition to its historic landmarks and its breathtaking views of Raritan Bay, the 265-acre park boasts a newly refurbished playground, a Visitors Center, expanded paths, and hiking and biking trails. Another great park destination is the “South Pole,” marking the southernmost point of New York State. Art exhibitions and galleries within each house will be open.

Covid-19 protocols will be followed.

Masks required inside houses.

Start time: 12:00 pm

End time: 4:00 pm

Contact phone: (917) 886-4389

Location: Conference House Park Visitor Center (in Conference House Park)
location: Conference House Park Visitor Center (in Conference House Park)
categories: Art | History | Tours | Seniors | Open House New York

description:

Staten Island artist Lisa Dahl premieres paintings that focus on the idea of our homes, communities, and our ties with nature and each other. The newly updated exhibition space is located in the Rutan-Becket House on the grounds of Conference House Park. The imagery of houses combined with the organic patterns of nature creates a synergy with the surroundings of the park and its historic buildings.

This exhibition received support from the New York City Artist Corps.

Free admission. Masks required. All current COVID-19 protocols to be followed.

title: Movies Under the Stars: SHOCTOBERFEST -  A Quiet Place Part II
description:
Date: October 17, 2021

Join NYC Parks and New York City Mayor's Office of Media and Entertainment at SHOCKTOBERFEST for these spooky films!

A Quiet Place Part II

Following the deadly events at home, the Abbott family must now face the terrors of the outside world as they continue their fight for survival in silence. Forced to venture into the unknown, they quickly realize that the creatures that hunt by sound are not the only threats that lurk beyond the sand path. Rated PG-13.

Know Before You Go
You should come arrive 6:15 p.m. to get your spot for the movie. Please bring your own picnic blanket or chair. Food is OK, but no alcohol or smoking is permitted. All are welcome!

For everyone's safety, we are asking all participants to observe the following guidelines:

  • Please wear a mask if you are unvaccinated, or if it makes you feel more comfortable
  • All individuals should maintain social distancing of six feet during programming, regardless of vaccination status
  • Please wear a mask if social distancing cannot be maintained
  • Wash your hands before attending a program
  • Stay home if you are sick

Please refer to the NY State Department of Health's website for updates and CDC's guidance on large gatherings regarding COVID-19 restrictions.

Contact (212) 360-1430 or accessibility@parks.nyc.gov for more information regarding accessibility.

Start time: 6:15 pm

End time: 7:55 pm

Contact phone: 7189658942

Location: Cooper Park
categories: Film | Halloween

description:

The exhibition will be on display at the Lenape Gallery at the Conference House Park Visitors Center through the end of the year.

Free admission.

All current COVID-19 protocols to be followed

title: Exhibit: Fire and Tide - Terra Marine Inn: A Brief History of Huguenot Park, Staten Island
description:
Date: October 18, 2021

Explore a bit of Staten Island's past and history.

The Fire and Tide exhibition explores the history of the former turn of the century Terra Marine Inn. This hotel was a wonderful piece of Staten Island gilded past. The exhibit combines history and original artwork focusing on the bygone location.

Free admission. Exhibit on display through December.

All COVID-19 protocols to be followed.

title: Open House New York: Historic Houses of Conference House Park
description:
Date: October 18, 2021

Conference House Park is a great destination for both park and history buffs. Located at the southernmost point of New York State, this park houses several historic buildings that trace the history of the borough over the course of three centuries. Three of these will be open to the public for the 2021 Open House New York Weekend: the Conference House, the Biddle House, and the Rutan-Becket House.

In addition to its historic landmarks and its breathtaking views of Raritan Bay, the 265-acre park boasts a newly refurbished playground, a Visitors Center, expanded paths, and hiking and biking trails. Another great park destination is the “South Pole,” marking the southernmost point of New York State. Art exhibitions and galleries within each house will be open.

Covid-19 protocols will be followed.

Masks required inside houses.

Start time: 12:00 pm

End time: 4:00 pm

Contact phone: (917) 886-4389

Location: Conference House Park Visitor Center (in Conference House Park)

categories: Art | History | Tours | Seniors | Open House New York

title: Exhibit: The Perfect Sea Mural
description:
Date: October 19, 2021

Members of the South Shore Artists Group created an engaging and interactive mural entitled "The Perfect Sea" to educate children and adults about the sea and its ecology; in particular, how pollution affects sea life in our local waters.

The exhibition will be on display at the Lenape Gallery at the Conference House Park Visitors Center through the end of the year.

Free admission.

All current COVID-19 protocols to be followed

title: Exhibit: Fire and Tide - Terra Marine Inn: A Brief History of Huguenot Park, Staten Island
description:
Date: October 19, 2021

Explore a bit of Staten Island's past and history.

The Fire and Tide exhibition explores the history of the former turn of the century Terra Marine Inn. This hotel was a wonderful piece of Staten Island gilded past. The exhibit combines history and original artwork focusing on the bygone location.

Free admission. Exhibit on display through December.

All COVID-19 protocols to be followed.

Start time: 10:00 am

End time: 4:00 pm

categories: Art | History

title: Fall Volunteer Days at the Bronx River Foodway
description:
Date: October 19, 2021

Lend a hand and connect with community and friends during our upcoming First Saturdays at the Foodway programming! Support morning stewardship, which includes gardening and beautifying of New York City's only edible food forest. Join us as well for some tours around our food forest, where we discuss the value of these herbs and veggies for both our health and the environment.

Hand sanitizer, masks, gloves, social distancing guidelines, and temperature checks provided to prevent the spread of Covid-19.

Thank you for being interested in volunteering with the Bronx River Alliance. You are committing to a special effort during a special time.

Please review the NYC Guidelines for Volunteering in Parks during COVID:

  • Stay home if sick (e.g., running a fever, coughing, experiencing loss of taste or smell, or other Covid-19 symptoms)
  • Maintain 6 feet of distance
  • Wash hands and clean surfaces frequently
  • Wear face coverings

Start time: 10:00 am

End time: 12:00 pm

Contact phone: (718) 542-4284

Location: Concrete Plant Park
categories: Nature | Best for Kids | Tours | Volunteer | Waterfront

Animals are released each season to ensure that their behaviors and life cycles are minimally impacted.

title: Summer on the Hudson: Moving For Life
description:
Date: October 19, 2021

Moving for Life is a gentle workout that begins with breathing exercises, then moves into active aerobic dancing that strengthens body awareness.

Pre-registration for the event is required. Management reserves the right to cap participation in accordance with current COVID-19 outdoor safety guidelines.

Please register online.

Please note: We are offering outdoor programs with limited attendance so that you can have a safe and enjoyable time in parks. Based on New York State guidance for outdoor events during COVID-19, we’ve put protocols into place to keep our participants and staff safe and healthy. We're asking everyone to help us stay safe.

Know Before You Go:

For everyone's safety, we are asking all participants to observe the following guidelines:

  • Please wear a mask if you are unvaccinated, or if it makes you feel more comfortable
  • All individuals should maintain social distancing of six feet during programming, regardless of vaccination status
  • Please wear a mask if social distancing cannot be maintained
  • Wash your hands before attending a program
  • Stay home if you are sick

Additionally, we encourage participants to bring their own hand sanitizer to our programs.

Start time: 5:30 pm

End time: 6:30 pm

Contact phone: (212) 870-3070

title: ‘Death Cannot Make Our Souls Afraid’: 19th Century Mourning Customs
description:
Date: October 19, 2021

Grief was more than just an emotion for Americans during the 19th century — it was a way of life. The moment Seabury Tredwell drew his last breath, in March 1865, his family put into motion an elaborate system of mourning customs that both announced their grief to the community and provided some measure of release from their suffering.

Join Museum Historian Ann Haddad for a virtual lecture to explore the origins and significance of these somber yet comforting rituals, from widows’ weeds and crepe-draped mirrors to corpse coolers and funeral biscuits.

Start time: 6:00 pm

End time: 7:00 pm

Contact phone: (212) 777-1089

Location: Virtual/Online Workshop
categories: History | Halloween | Talks | Virtual/Online Events
